result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

1:44 PM Defendant Monica M Ocampo in court.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Monica M Ocampo.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing in 22CF1757.
Defendant now has a second case.
Defense requests to address the waiver of preliminary hearing in the new matter and requests more time to obtain a global offer.
Court addresses waiver of preliminary hearing in 22CF105.
Court conducts colloquy on waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files an Information.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Court addresses WCS letter filed in 22CF1757.
Defendant to provide WCS with a copy of her therapy schedule and file a copy with the court with proof that it was shared with WCS.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.

8:36 AM Defendant Monica M Ocampo in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brandon Carlson in court as a friend of the Court for Attorney Ronald Sonderhouse. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Attorney Carlson is waiving time limits and asking for this matter to tag along with the defendant's other matter. The Court will set this matter with the defendant's other matter.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
